item.title: Keynotes & Program Committee
item.description: PC members: Dr. Shaun Canavan, University of South Florida, USA, scanavan@usf.edu Prof. Yuan-Pin Lin,National Sun Yat-Sen University, Taiwan, yplin0115@gmail.com Prof. Mohammad Soleymani, University of Southern California, USA, soleymani@ict.usc.edu Dr. Guangyi Zhang, Harvard University, USA, gzhang14@mgh.harvard.edu Guanhua Zhang, University of Stuttgart, Germany, Guanhua.Zhang@vis.uni-stuttgart.de Dr. Guozhen Zhao, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China, zhaogz@psych.ac.cn Prof. Wei-Long Zheng,Shanghai Jiao Tong University, China, weilonglive@gmail.com Prof. Wenming Zheng, Southeast University, China, wenming_zheng@seu.edu.cn Keynote speakers Dr. Guillaume Chanel, University of Geneva and HEPIA, Switzerland, Guillaume.

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description: First Workshop on Generalizability of Emotion Recognition from EEG Signals at ACII’24 The first workshop on Generalizability of Emotion Recognition from EEG Signals (EmoRec EEG) at ACII’24 is designed to improve the comparability and generalizability of EEG emotion recognition approaches. We invite submissions on emotion recognition from Electroencephalography (EEG) signals in two tracks: Challenge Track: In this track, we invite submissions addressing at least one of two well-defined EEG emotion recognition tasks.

item.title: Organizers
item.description: Dr. Benedikt Wirth German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence, Saarbrücken, Germany Dr. Philipp Müller German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence, Saarbrücken, Germany Dr. Laura Ferrari Scuola Superiore Sant’Anna, Pisa, Italy & INRIA, Sophia Antipolis, France Natia Kukhilava Muskhelishvili Institute of Computational Mathematics (MICM), Tbilisi, Georgia Tatia Tsmindashvili Muskhelishvili Institute of Computational Mathematics (MICM), Tbilisi, Georgia Dr. Francois Bremond INRIA, Sophia Antipolis, France Acknowledgements The EmoRec EEG workshop is supported by the European Commission HORIZON EUROPE WIDERA-2021-ACCESS-03 Grant Project GAIN (grant agreement no.
